document.title: Type selector
document.paragraph:
The type selector contains all the available Vision2 types supported by EiffelBuild. These are the basic building blocks for your system.
/images/eiffelbuild/screenshots/type_selector.png
The types are organized into three groups - Primitives, Containers and Items. All types that may be used in EiffelBuild have a text in uppercase, corresponding to their type in
/libraries/vision2/00_introduction.xml EiffelVision2 . For example, looking at the screenshot above, the BUTTON item represents an EV_BUTTON, and the EV_COMBO_BOX item represents EV_COMBO_BOX.
Note: The types available in the type selector are fixed, and cannot be modified. Almost all
/libraries/vision2/00_introduction.xml EiffelVision2 components are available.
2Creating a new object
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject Objects are the building blocks used in EiffelBuild to construct your interface. To create a new
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object for use in your system,
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlpick_and_drop pick the type corresponding to the type of object you wish to create,and
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlpick_and_drop drop onto an
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object representation. If an object is full, or does not allow other objects of the new type to be contained, then you will not be able to
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlpick_and_drop drop on it.
For example, if you have just started a new project,
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlpick_and_drop pick HORIZONTAL_BOX from the type selector, and drop it on the EV_TITLED_WINDOW
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object displayed in the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/20_layout_constructor/index.xml layout constructor . This will build you a new
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object of type EV_HORIZONTAL_BOX, parented in the window. If you then
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlpick_and_drop pick a BUTTON from the type selector, you will not be able to
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlpick_and_drop drop it on the EV_TITLED_WINDOW, as a window may only contain one child and is therefore currently full. You may however,
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlpick_and_drop drop on the EV_HORIZONTAL_BOX object you had just created, as the box is empty, and has space for multiple children. Doing so, will create a new
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object of type EV_BUTTON, parented in the box.
This shows how simple it is to Build new
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject objects in EiffelBuild, you just need access to the parent
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object to
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlpick_and_drop drop the selected type into.
You may drop an object directly from the Type Selector into the ../64_widget_selector/index.xmlwidget selector which creates the object as a "top level object" ensuring that upon generation, it is represented by an individual set of classes. These top level objects may then be re-used within your interface as desired.
Note: To understand the types accepted, and the capacity of objects, you should consult the
/libraries/vision2/00_introduction.xml EiffelVision2 library reference.
2Changing the type of an existing object
Why would you want to change the type of an existing
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object , when you could just delete it and create a new
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object ?
Imagine you have spent some time constructing a complicated interface. You have an EV_VERTICAL_BOX with children many levels deep. You realize that you wanted the EV_VERTICAL_BOX to be of type EV_HORIZONTAL_BOX. If you delete the object, all children contained will also be deleted, which in this case, is not what you want. Changing the type of the object does actually delete the object internally, but will automatically re-parent all of its children into the new object. To perform a type change,
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlpick_and_drop pick the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object that you wish to change, and
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlpick_and_drop drop it on an item in the type selector representing the desired new type. All existing children of the old
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object will be automatically re-parented in the new object.
The following rules govern if the type of an existing object may be changed to a new type:
The parent of the existing
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject object must accept children of type corresponding to the new type.
The new type must be able to accept all of the existing
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.xmlobject objects children.
